column3: str
Greetings! I take it you have come to see me about a retainer.
Retainers are hardworking lads and lasses who will help you to manage those spoils earned while off slaying dragons or whatever it is you adventurers do.
Unfortunately, you do not appear you could even slay an eft, let alone a dragon, therefore I must decline any petition you may have to take a retainer into your employ.

Build yourself a reputation in this city, however, and I shall provide you with whatever it is you need. Might I suggest you start by heading back to the Adventurers' Guild and seeing if someone there has work for you?
What would you like to do?
Small Talk.
Hire a retainer.
Release a retainer.
Change a retainer's appearance and nickname.
Ask about retainers.
Inquire about retainer jobs.
View market tax rates.
Nothing.
Dispatch a retainer to Limsa Lominsa.
Dispatch a retainer to Gridania.
Dispatch a retainer to Ul'dah.
Dispatch a retainer to Ishgard.
Dispatch a retainer to Kugane.
Dispatch a retainer to Old Sharlayan.
Dispatch a retainer to Tuliyollal.
What will you ask?
Who are retainers?
What services can retainers provide?
How do I summon a retainer?
Nothing

Retainers are men and women who offer their services in exchange for coin. Though they're seldom as sharp as adventurers like yourself, they're no strangers to life's more menial tasks─tasks which your lot might not think worth your time.

Retainers can provide a host of different services, from tending your items to protecting your gil. Oh, and you need not worry about providing recompense for a retainer's services, for the Adventurers' Guild will not only cover his salary, but also replace anything that goes missing, should you wake up to find your belongings gone and your retainer nowhere to be found.
Another job retainers are often asked to perform is the tending of items placed up for sale in the markets─something many adventurers cannot be bothered to do themselves.
If you wish to experience the market for yourself, I ask that you seek out one of the nearby boards.
Retainers in your employ can be summoned at any time using special bells like the one nearby.
Summoning bells can also be found around the realm in oft-visited locations such as city markets and inns.

Tax on items sold in the <Sheet(Town,IntegerParameter(1),0)/> markets is the normal rate of <Value>IntegerParameter(2)</Value>%.
Learn about Market Tax
To make their markets more attractive to prospective sellers, cities will often lower the percentage of tax that is collected from each sale.
Reduced tax rate periods can end earlier than indicated if areas require maintenance.
According to our records, you may hire up to <Value>IntegerParameter(1)</Value> retainers.
Currently, you have no retainers in your employ.
Currently, you have <Value>IntegerParameter(1)</Value> <If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),1))>retainer<Else/>retainers</If> in your employ.
While customizing your retainer, you will be unable to communicate with players and engage in other activities.
Excellent. We have quite a few men and women on our lists, so I invite you to describe the retainer you desire, down to the most minute detail.
Beginning the retainer customization process will automatically cancel your Duty Finder registration.
Withdraw duty registration and hire a retainer?

I can think of several retainers that are exactly as you describe. Oddly enough, they have strikingly different personalities. If you would be so kind as to state a preference, it would be most helpful.
Select your retainer's personality.
Polite.
Rough.
Serious.
Carefree.
Independent.
Lively.
Very well, I have just the individual in mind. When summoned, this retainer will greet you just so:
And when dismissed, this retainer will bid you farewell just so:
Hire this retainer?
Excellent. It is also customary to give a retainer an appellation of one's own making─a nickname, as it were. We find this deepens the bond between our clients and their retainers.
Retainer Nickname
Give your retainer a nickname.

Names must be at least 3 characters long and can contain letters, apostrophes, and hyphens. Please note, however, that hyphens cannot be used in succession or placed immediately before or after apostrophes.
Are you certain you wish to cancel the hiring process?
Hire the services of <Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight>?
Hire a retainer?
Yes
No
One moment, please, while I draft the proper documentation.
Congratulations! <Clickable(<Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight>)/> is now in your employ.
You can summon your new retainer using the nearby bell.
If you have any further questions or requests, please do not hesitate to ask.
The name you have chosen is not available. Please select another.
I am sorry, but you cannot hire any more retainers.
Understood. If you change your mind, speak with me again.
Select the retainer you wish to send to the markets in Limsa Lominsa.

Yes
No
You...are dissatisfied with one of your retainers? Very well. If you would be so kind as to inform me which retainer is lacking, we can begin the review process.

You may change your retainers' nicknames or instruct them to visit the aesthetician at any time. If you desire more drastic changes to a retainer's appearance or personality, the retainer vocate will assist you in finding a replacement of comparable skill and experience.
Review your specifications for <Clickable(<Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight>)/>?
Yes
No
Then you <Emphasis>are</Emphasis> completely satisfied with your retainer? Understood. Pray speak with me again should your preferences change.
Withdraw duty registration and review your retainer?
Very well. First, let us review your retainer's current appearance. I must ask that you describe in detail which aspects you find unappealing, and what you would prefer.
I see... Next, I would have you confirm your preference with regards to personality. “The right retainer for the right person,” as we are wont to say.
To ensure there is no misunderstanding, know that your retainer will address you just so:
Are you satisfied with this personality?
Understood. Finally, I must needs verify the nickname you would give your retainer. You may register the same nickname if you like.
Are you certain you wish to cancel the review process?
Complete your review of <Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight>?
One moment, please, while I draft the proper documentation.
Forgive me, but you must first instruct your retainer to remove all equipment. A necessary precaution, in light of past incidents.
Our records indicate that your retainer is currently undertaking a venture. Until that is no longer the case, I fear we cannot begin the review process.
Due to unforeseen circumstances, we cannot review your retainer at this time.
I am pleased to inform you that your review has been processed, and <Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight> is now ready to serve you.
You can summon your retainer using the nearby bell.
Very well. Allow me a moment to locate your documentation.
It does not appear you have any retainers in your employ at this time.
Confirm the retainer you wish to release.
Release <Clickable(<Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight>)/>?

Release <Clickable(<Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight>)/>?
Please be advised that retainers placed in estates will not be automatically removed.
Yes
No
<Clickable(<Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight>)/> is released from service.
Our records show that the retainer you wish to release is still in possession of several of your belongings, and may have placed a number of them for sale on the market.
You must retrieve those belongings before I can approve the dismissal.
Understood. The retainer shall remain in your employ. Speak with me again if you change your mind.
What would you like to do?
Ask about assigning your retainer a job.
Ask about job requirements.
Purchase a copy of <Emphasis>Modern Vocation</Emphasis>.
Nothing.
By popular demand, we have prepared an exhaustive publication to aid clients who would have their retainers train in certain ancient or esoteric traditions.

To assign your retainer a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>job<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>, you must first obtain <SheetEn(Item,1,IntegerParameter(1),1,1)/>, which can be purchased from the retainer vocate for 40 ventures.

Furthermore, you must have achieved level 50 in the job you wish to assign your retainer. Please note that the jobs you can assign your retainer are determined by their class. Limited jobs are not available.
If you wish to assign a level 50 retainer a job which is not currently available, you will need to reset and change their class.
As you may know, a certain measure of experience is required before a retainer may train in a more advanced tradition.
Select a class.
<Clickable(<Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/>)/>.
Return.
A retainer who has been assigned the <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/> class may be eligible to train in the following traditions:
Select a job.
<Clickable(<Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/>)/>.
Return.

To assign your retainer the <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/> job, you yourself must first achieve level 50 as <If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),10))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),14))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),5))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),26))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),33))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/>a <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/></If></If></If></If></If>. Additionally, your retainer must have achieved level 30 as <If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),10))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),14))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),5))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),26))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),33))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/>a <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/></If></If></If></If></If>.

To assign your retainer the <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/> job, you yourself must first achieve level 50 as <If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),10))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),14))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),5))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),26))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),33))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/>a <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/></If></If></If></If></If>. Additionally, your retainer must have achieved level 50 as a Disciple of War or Magic.

To assign your retainer the <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/> job, you yourself must first achieve level 60 as <If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),10))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),14))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),5))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),26))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),33))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/>a <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/></If></If></If></If></If>. Additionally, your retainer must have achieved level 60 as a Disciple of War or Magic.

To assign your retainer the <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/> job, you yourself must first achieve level 70 as <If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),10))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),14))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),5))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),26))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),33))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/>a <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/></If></If></If></If></If>. Additionally, your retainer must have achieved level 70 as a Disciple of War or Magic.

To assign your retainer the <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/> job, you yourself must first achieve level 80 as <If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),10))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),14))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),5))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),26))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),33))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/>a <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/></If></If></If></If></If>. Additionally, your retainer must have achieved level 80 as a Disciple of War or Magic.
Ahem. If I am not mistaken, do you not already have a copy of that publication in your possession?
You already possess a copy of <Emphasis>Modern Vocation</Emphasis>. You may summon a retainer and assign them a job, if they meet the necessary requirements.
Exchange 40 ventures for <SheetEn(Item,1,IntegerParameter(1),1,1)/>?
Yes
No
Unable to obtain <SheetEn(Item,2,IntegerParameter(1),1,1)/>. Your inventory is full.
Unable to purchase <SheetEn(Item,2,IntegerParameter(1),1,1)/>. You do not have enough ventures.
If you possess a venture promissory note, you may redeem it for ventures through a Calamity salvager.
You exchange 40 ventures for <SheetEn(Item,2,IntegerParameter(1),1,1)/>.
You may now summon a retainer and assign them a job, if they meet the necessary requirements.
(-Polite Hyuran Male-)I have come, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If>.
(-Rough Hyuran Male-)Nothin' fer ye to worry about.
(-Serious Hyuran Male-)You summoned?
(-Carefree Hyuran Male-)Yes? <sigh> I hope this doesn't take long...
(-Independent Hyuran Male-)You wish to see how a master handles a bazaar?
(-Lively Hyuran Male-)Hello, hello! You called?
(-Polite Hyuran Female-)At your service, my <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lady<Else/>lord</If>.
(-Rough Hyuran Female-)What's it to be this time, love?
(-Serious Hyuran Female-)What would you ask?
(-Carefree Hyuran Female-)I'm so sorry to keep you waiting, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. So very, very sorry.
(-Independent Hyuran Female-)Quickly now, I've places to be.
(-Lively Hyuran Female-)Well, if it ain't my favorite client! Always a pleasure, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>!
(-Polite Elezen Male-)Yes, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>? What is your bidding?
(-Rough Elezen Male-)What's on the agenda, chief? Deprivin' saps o' their hard-earned gil?
(-Serious Elezen Male-)I have come. You may proceed.
(-Carefree Elezen Male-)Oh, hello there. To what do I owe the pleasure?
(-Independent Elezen Male-)I am come to conduct business, and only business.

(-Lively Elezen Male-)You look to be in good health, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. How may I assist you this fine <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>eve<Else/>morn</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>eve</If></If>?
(-Polite Elezen Female-)What is it you would have me do, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>?
(-Rough Elezen Female-)Usually, it's me doin' the summons and others doin' the waitin'.
(-Serious Elezen Female-)Is there something that I can help you with?
(-Carefree Elezen Female-)Oh, why must you summon me at a time like this...?
(-Independent Elezen Female-)I'm sure there is a perfectly good explanation for this summons.
(-Lively Elezen Female-)You know, I thought you might be along to summon me. You may rest assured that I am ready and eager to serve.
(-Polite Lalafellin Male-)Hail to thee, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. Your humble servant has heard your summons.
(-Rough Lalafellin Male-)Greetin's and salutations, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>. Pray speak yer desires, an' I'll do me damndest to see 'em done.
(-Serious Lalafellin Male-)I was wondering when you'd get around to calling me.
(-Carefree Lalafellin Male-)Mind if we keep this brief? I've got a pretty little thing that's waitin' for me.
(-Independent Lalafellin Male-)What?
(-Lively Lalafellin Male-)I'm here, I'm here!
(-Polite Lalafellin Female-)Here I am, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If>, as per your request.
(-Rough Lalafellin Female-)'Ello, dearie. What's on the docket?
(-Serious Lalafellin Female-)I never miss a chance to line these pockets.
(-Carefree Lalafellin Female-)Well, this is unexpected! What'll it be?
(-Independent Lalafellin Female-)What is it now?
(-Lively Lalafellin Female-)Here I aaaaaam!
(-Polite Miqo'te Male-)How may I be of serrrvice, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>?
(-Rough Miqo'te Male-)It's a war out there, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>. You have no idea.
(-Serious Miqo'te Male-)...
(-Carefree Miqo'te Male-)Business or pleasure?
(-Independent Miqo'te Male-)I presume you did not summon me solely for the pleasure of my company.
(-Lively Miqo'te Male-)Just the <If(PlayerParameter(4))>fair maiden<Else/>handsome fellow</If> I was hoping to see! Tell me your heart's desire.
(-Polite Miqo'te Female-)I hope your catcall is not one of disapproval.
(-Rough Miqo'te Female-)Ye rang, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>?
(-Serious Miqo'te Female-)A cat's ears do not miss much―least of all a summons.
(-Carefree Miqo'te Female-)Curiosity called the cat. What do you have for me today?
(-Independent Miqo'te Female-)Ready when you are.
(-Lively Miqo'te Female-)I was just thinking of you!
(-Polite Roegadyn Male-)What need have you of me today, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>?
(-Rough Roegadyn Male-)Bwahahaha! Ye got work needs gettin' done? Just point me in the right bloody direction.
(-Serious Roegadyn Male-)I've come. What is it?
(-Carefree Roegadyn Male-)Hey there─hic─<If(PlayerParameter(4))>missy<Else/>mate</If>! Care to join me fer a pint?
(-Independent Roegadyn Male-)Couldn't come no quicker. Where's the work?
(-Lively Roegadyn Male-)I came runnin' soon as I heard the bell! Ye need somethin', chief?
(-Polite Roegadyn Female-)I am at your disposal, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>.
(-Rough Roegadyn Female-)Ye got somethin' fer me, cap'n?
(-Serious Roegadyn Female-)Go ahead, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>.
(-Carefree Roegadyn Female-)Let's keep this short and sweet, shall we?
(-Independent Roegadyn Female-)This wouldn't be necessary if you entrusted your financial affairs to me.
(-Lively Roegadyn Female-)So─sellin', buyin', drinkin', whorin'? What's it to be today?
(-Polite Auri Male-)Greetings, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. How may I be of service?
(-Rough Auri Male-)What'll it be, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>mate</If>?
(-Serious Auri Male-)State your business.

(-Carefree Auri Male-)And how does this wonderful <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>evening<Else/>day</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>evening</If></If> find you?
(-Independent Auri Male-)Well... Here I am...<If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If>.

(-Lively Auri Male-)We work the market stalls,♪
And our uniforms are pretty;♪
We are sober men and true,♪
And attentive to our duties!♪
(-Polite Auri Female-)<If(PlayerParameter(4))>My lady<Else/>My lord</If>. What would you ask of me?
(-Rough Auri Female-)So. We doing this?
(-Serious Auri Female-)Yes?
(-Carefree Auri Female-)Hey, it's...it's you! Hello again, you!
(-Independent Auri Female-)I-It's not like I want to sell your items or anything.
(-Lively Auri Female-)What do you have for me? Come on, come on! Don't be shy!
(-Polite Hrothgar Male-)You rang, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>?
(-Rough Hrothgar Male-)I trust this will be worth my while.
(-Serious Hrothgar Male-)<Emphasis>What</Emphasis>?
(-Carefree Hrothgar Male-)Whatever you need, leave it to me! I have my methods.
(-Independent Hrothgar Male-)Gahaha! If it isn't my favorite <If(PlayerParameter(4))>mistress<Else/>master</If>!
(-Lively Hrothgar Male-)It is I, your most loyal and capable retainer!
(-Polite Viera Female-)What will it be, love?
(-Rough Viera Female-)Your orders! I would hear them at once!
(-Serious Viera Female-)If there is something you would ask of me, then ask it.
(-Carefree Viera Female-)Yes...? Is there something you─<yawn>─need?
(-Independent Viera Female-)A task for me? I hope it's something fun!
(-Lively Viera Female-)I am here to do your every bidding, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If>! Ask of me anything at all!

(-Polite Viera Male-)I have been awaiting your summons, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. What would you have of me this fine <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>evening<Else/>morning</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>evening</If></If>?
(-Rough Viera Male-)What can I do for ye, yer <If(PlayerParameter(4))>ladyship<Else/>lordship</If>?
(-Serious Viera Male-)You called, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>...?
(-Carefree Viera Male-)You─hic─rang?
(-Independent Viera Male-)Need my assistance, do you? Let's make this quick, then.
(-Lively Viera Male-)You have my ear, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>. Both of them, in fact!
(-Polite Hrothgar Female-)You summoned me, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>?
(-Rough Hrothgar Female-)At your beck an' call, I am!
(-Serious Hrothgar Female-)You called, and I have come.
(-Carefree Hrothgar Female-)At last─I thought you'd <Emphasis>never</Emphasis> call. What does <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If> need of me?
